description: Are you up for the toughest AI challenges around graph neural networks? We have built a graph-based patent search engine with which our users find the documents that already contain their concepts. We are looking for an Machine Learning Engineer who can envision breakthrough-level ideas and follow them through with software engineering excellence. You will be working with the very core of the product - the search algorithm.We have converted 100M patent documents into 100M knowledge graphs, to compress the key information into simpler data for ML. It has been possible because of the semi-structured patent text. Patent documents also contain rich metadata like citations between documents, which are essentially labels for supervised training. All of this presents an opportunity to dive deeper into text understanding than even the LLMs from the tech giants.The current model we use is the Graph Transformer (read our blog about the graph transformer), so both the NLP transformers and the GNN models are relevant. We published a paper at the SIGIR 2023 conference about our general approach (read our paper).The daily work is done in a small hybrid team. Remote work is okay, but we expect to see each other at least once a quarter in person. There is also a separate team providing MLOps support.Technology stackPyTorch for search model developmentML services deployed as Python microservicesGoogle Cloud for computationRequirementsExcellence in applied deep learning, ideally also with GNNsA genuine eagerness to learnKnowledge about NLPStrong social skillsFluency in English, which is our company languageYou are located ideally in Finland, but at least you can work in European time zonesBenefitsA rare opportunity to join an early-stage, disruptive company that has a unique edge, ambitious plans, and an already proven record of success in a growing $2bn industryOpportunities to grow as we grow. We will help you be the best you can be in this role, and help you develop skills that will help you reach the next stage. You will work with a highly talented and supportive teamA compelling and competitive financial package and other benefits, including six weeks of holidayIn Finland, other benefits include for example lunch, sports and culture, and commuting benefits, extended occupational health care with dental care, and tools of your choosingNext stepsOur recruitment process consists ofA casual interview with our AI Team Lead Sebastian and Head of People and Talent Mari, in which we will discuss your background and check if our wishes align with yoursWe would like to see an example of your code. You can share your Github profile with us or do a code task if that’s what you preferA technical interview with Sebastian and an AI team member to dig deeper into your technical skillsA final call with our CTO JuhoSounds interesting? Send us an application now!About IPRallyIPRally will change the way of finding and categorizing patents. How? We have introduced transparent and reliable AI applications to the patent search, analysis, and classification process, which helps our customers save a lot of time, resources, and money. We are transforming the complex and tedious process of finding information that is crucial for our customers, but most importantly, we help innovative companies quickly find and act upon opportunities and drastically reduce risk.So, who are we? IPRally was founded in Helsinki, Finland in 2018. With a vision to automate tasks that steal resources from both inventors and patent professionals and help them achieve their goals faster, a completely new and ground-breaking way of searching for technical information was built. By modeling the technical content of patents, and processing this with cutting-edge, proprietary graph neural networks, IPRally gives customers highly relevant information at their fingertips, in seconds.

At Silo AI our team of 200+ AI Engineers, AI Scientists, Solutions Architects, Software Developers, and Designers collaborate closely to tackle challenging real-world problems related to AI. Now we are looking for AI Engineers to build MLOps solutions for quality ML development and scalable AI utilizations in multi-cloud environments. The work is done as part of our Helsinki, Tampere, Turku, Jyväskylä, Oulu, Stockholm or Copenhagen teams.What Will You Be DoingBuilding versatile ML development and AI deployment setups (pipelines and/or platforms) and other MLOps solutions to enable production-level AI and ML in multi-cloud environments and sometimes in connection to IoT and embedded settingsWork very practically hand-on but also designing the needed architectures and workflows - enabled by Silo AI assets and learning from versatile project casesWork as part of the team with leading AI experts and use cutting edge tools to train, deploy and service advanced machine learning models Working in client projects in various different industries that typically lasts 3-6 months, but we also work in long-term projects lasting 1-2 years Contributing to Cloud AI & MLOps community and R&D work of Silo AIWhat We Are Looking For From YouYou have strong experience in software development Experience in training, versioning, deploying, monitoring and/or maintaining machine learning modelsYou have knowledge of cloud platforms and technologies (e.g. Kubernetes, Azure, AWS and/or Google Cloud)You are experienced in programming with Python and can adopt other programming languages. You are familiar with some typical MLOps tools, such as KubeFlow, MLFlow, KFServing/KServe, Seldon, Airflow, Argo, Prefect or others; some DevOps tooling such as Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform scripting (or CloudFormation or similar); some machine learning frameworks, such as Tensorflow and/or PyTorch; some logging tools, such as ElasticStack, Grafana, Prometheus and/or othersYou have a track record of producing quality code and developing software with different practices (CI/CD, version control, some variety of agile development)You may have also DataOps related experience around storage (SQL, NoSQL, cloud), processing (batch, stream, ETL), managing/versioning, security, visualization and/or big dataYou are interested in working and communicating with Silo AI clients and working part of the team with Silo experts Be able to learn new skills and adapt quickly, as the problems, tools, best practices, and architectures are rapidly changing. What Silo Ai Offers To YouReal-world and production-level projects related to AI in various different industries such as retail, manufacturing, machine industry, automotive, pharma, telecom, smart devices, medical, energy & infra, logistics, healthcare, and internet services High-level & diverse tech and non-tech expertise around you as peers with our team of 200+ employees and 20+ nationalities Cloud AI & MLOps community which includes 30+ experts and a lot of information sharing and learning resources - and our other three technology areas include IoT, Embedded and Connectivity which bring their own additions to the MLOps work Learning culture with several different learning activities to support your learning such as 1-1 talent coaching with lead level experts, self-development benefit, company-wide workshops, internal research club bi-weekly basis Silo social activities like daily meditation, virtual lunches, and company-wide all-hands every Friday, company supported Silo social activities Growth company environment - in 2021 we have hired around 100 new employees and opened up a new office in Copenhagen, Denmark. In 2022 we are looking for hiring even more employees than in 2021 and opening up new countries in addition to the three current ones. Possibility to become Silo shareholderNormal benefits such as work equipment of own choice, occupational healthcare, sports & culture vouchers, internet, lunch through Wolt on Fridays, self-development budgetOUR CULTUREWhat we believe in at SiloBuild bonds - Trust is our bond. We connect with customers and seek to understand how we can best help, and always keep what we promise. We encourage a culture in which successes are celebrated, learnings shared and support provided for our team members to succeed. Be good - Positive impact. We strive to be transparent and open, take responsibility and ownership, and aim for positive impact and results in all we do. We take pride in creating an equal and supportive workplace for talented and ambitious professionals from all nationalities, genders, and backgrounds. Ask why - Know your why. We have the courage and agility to keep challenging what we're doing to assure value creation for customers. We encourage open dialogue and debate and strive for diversity in opinions to improve decision making. Keep learning - Grow to excel. We aim for excellence by learning from the market, sharing our competence, and recruiting a growth mindset. For us expertise is not an achievement, it's a lifestyle of curiosity, learning, sharing, and working with people who share the same hunger. WANT TO KNOW MORE?You can ask more about Silo AI as a workplace from our Talent Acquisition Lead Emmi Matvejeff, emmi.matvejeff@silo.ai

job-title: MLOps/Data Engineer - Helsinki - up to 6500€/pm + stocks
description: Senior MLOps/Data Engineer - Helsinki - up to 6500€/pm + stocksOur partner has opened up a brand new MLOps Data Engineer role to join their growing SaaS start-up focusing on creating more agile and data-driven innovation processes.Responsibilities You will take strong ownership of their data, ML pipelines, and infra. You will be an individual contributor from the start of the data pipelines and machine learning productization. As you become more settled into the role, you will effectively lead a project coordinate technical work across the whole application stack, and effectively communicate with the product teamRequirements Technical experience: Python, SQL, AWS, and pulumi. Great communication skills both with technical and non-technical stakeholders Experience from at least two projects setting up data and/or machine learning infrastructure. High level of ambition, interest in growing professionally, and advancing career.There is a huge opportunity to grow within the company and be one of the biggest players in the field.My client is looking to begin the interview process ASAP with limited interview spots this and next week, so don't miss out, apply now!This is a brief description of the role, for the full information, simply apply to the role and I will call you to discuss.Twitter: @_JeffersonFrankLinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/jessica-lee-wright-54b242221/ |Email: j.wright@jeffersonfrank.comPhone: +358 75 326 3948Please Note: This is a permanent role. This role is for Finnish residents only. This role does not offer Sponsorship. You must have the right to work in Finland with no restrictions. Some of our roles may be subject to successful background/security checks.If this wasn't exactly the role you were looking for, please apply to this role anyway, just highlight what you are looking for, apply with your CV with a brief overview of what you are looking for (The role, top 3 techs, location, salary).I will call you to discuss your skill-set further, there may be other roles I am working on that you may be suited for.I specialize in Mobile, Web, and Cloud (AWS) recruitment here at Jefferson Frank International, focusing on the placement of highly-skilled candidates in various IT positions (Engineers, Analysts, Architects, Consultants, Project Managers, Management, etc.).We are the only global recruitment agency dedicated solely to AWS technology. Jefferson Frank is the AWS recruitment agency of choice. Whether it's a contract, permanent or remote position, we find great people great jobs.Jefferson FrankJefferson Frank is the Amazon Web Services (AWS) recruiter of choice. We work with organizations worldwide to find and deliver the best permanent and contract AWS DevOps, Big Data, IaaS and PaaS, and AWS Security

Valtiotieteellinen tiedekunta hakee KuluttajatutkimuskeskukseenPROJEKTISUUNNITTELIJAAvakinaiseen työsuhteeseen mahdollisimman pian kuitenkin viimeistään 1.1.2024.Kuluttajatutkimuskeskuksen kansallinen tehtävä on tutkia monitieteisesti merkittäviä yhteiskunnallisia ilmiöitä ja niiden vaikutuksia kuluttajien elämään, osallistua alan perusopetuksen antamiseen ja valtakunnalliseen tutkijakoulutukseen sekä osallistua tutkimusalan yhteiskunnallista vaikuttavuutta lisääviin kehittämishankkeisiin.Projektisuunnittelijan tehtävä on asiantuntijatehtävä, johon kuuluu vastuullisia suunnittelu-, valmistelu-, kehittämis- ja ylläpitotöitä. Työ liittyy tiiviisti Kuluttajatutkimuskeskuksen valtakunnallisen tehtävän menestyksekkääseen toteuttamiseen. Projektisuunnittelija työskentelee läheisesti keskuksen johtajan kanssa ja toimii keskuksen johtoryhmän sihteerinä. Hän vastaa keskuksen sisäisestä ja ulkoisesta viestinnästä (ml. sähköisen ja sosiaalisen viestinnän kanavat) ja on keskeinen henkilö monissa keskuksen yhteisissä toiminnoissa kuten tapahtumien ja kokousten järjestelyissä sekä tilojen ja tutkimusinfrastruktuurin hallinnoinnissa. Projektisuunnittelija neuvoo keskuksen henkilöstöä muuttuvaan yliopistoympäristöön liittyvissä asioissa. Lisäksi tehtävään kuuluu itsenäisiä ja koordinoitavia strategisten partnereiden kanssa toteutettavia projektiluontoisia töitä, joilla tavoitellaan yhteiskunnallista vaikuttavuutta. Tehtävään ei kuulu tutkimus- eikä opetustyötä.VALINTAKRITEERITTehtävään valittavalta toivotaan soveltuvaa ylempää korkeakoulututkintoa ja kokemusta tietojen hallinnasta monitieteisessä ympäristössä. Tehtävän menestyksellinen hoitaminen edellyttää kykyä tietojen analysointiin, innostuneisuutta oman työn ja osaamisen kehittämiseen, oma-aloitteisuutta ja erinomaista yhteistyökykyä. Tehtävässä tarvitaan hyvää suomen ja englannin kielen suullista ja kirjallista taitoa. Hyvä ruotsin kielen taito katsotaan eduksi.PALKKAProjektisuunnittelijan bruttopalkka on 2800 – 3400 €/kk riippuen tehtävään valittavan henkilön ansioista ja kokemuksesta.Tehtävässä on 6 kuukauden koeaika.Helsingin yliopisto tarjoaa työntekijöilleen monipuolisia mahdollisuuksia ja etuja kuten tukea osaamisen kehittämiseen ja liikunta- ja hyvinvointipalveluita. Lue lisätietoja uramahdollisuuksista ja eduista yliopiston sivuilta .HAKUOHJEETHakemus jätetään yliopiston sähköiseen rekrytointijärjestelmään Hae nyt -linkin kautta. Helsingin yliopistoon työsuhteessa olevat hakijat hakevat tehtävää Fiori-portaalin kautta https://msap.sap.helsinki.fi. Hakuaika päättyy 16.10.2023.LISÄTIEDOTLisätietoja tehtävästä antaa Kuluttajatutkimuskeskuksen johtaja Niilo Kauppi, niilo.kauppi@helsinki.fi.Rekrytointijärjestelmän tekninen tuki: rekrytointi@helsinki.fiValtiotieteellinen tiedekunta on Suomen johtava yhteiskuntatieteellinen tutkimus- ja koulutusyksikkö, joka on tieteenalavalikoimaltaan maan monipuolisin. Tiedekunnan tieteenalat menestyvät hyvin myös kansainvälisessä vertailuissa ollen monilla aloilla 50 parhaan joukossa. Tiedekunnalla on vahva kansainvälinen tutkimusprofiili, kansainvälisiä opetusohjelmia ja opiskelijoita. Henkilökunnan määrä on 500. Tiedekunnasta valmistuu vuosittain 350 kandidaattia, 400 maisteria ja yli 40 tohtoria.

job-title: Postdoctoral Researcher in Machine Learning for Non-destructive Testing
description: Aalto University is where science and art meet technology and business. We shape a sustainable future by making research breakthroughs in and across our disciplines, sparking the game changers of tomorrow and creating novel solutions to major global challenges. Our community is made up of 13 000 students, 400 professors and close to 4 500 other faculty and staff working on our dynamic campus in Espoo, Greater Helsinki, Finland. Diversity is part of who we are, and we actively work to ensure our community’s diversity and inclusiveness. This is why we warmly encourage qualified candidates from all backgrounds to join our community.Aalto University School of Engineering is now looking for an ambitiousPostdoctoral Researcher in Machine Learning for Non-destructive Testingto come and change the world of NDE with us.The use of machine learning in automated data analysis for non-destructive testing has started a revolution in how we work with inspection data. Recent research has shown, that machine learning models can reach human-level performance in data evaluation. This opens the door to next generation methods developed from the beginning to be integrated with machine learning. We invite you to apply for postdoctoral position at the Department of Mechanical Engineering.In the reseach project “Machine learning powered NDT”, we are working to enable new kind of NDE that uses AI/ML to seamlessly fuse data from different NDE modalities and to effectively evaluate data too voluminous for human inspectors.Your role and goalsYou’ll be driving this reseach and supporting doctoral students in the project. To succeed, you’ll need some background in both NDE and machine learning. You’ll need practical experience in tuning and training machine learning models with Python and Tensorflow or Pytorch. You’ll need a hands-on attitude, ready to go and acquire the data yourself, if need be.Your network and teamYou’ll work closely with Prof. (adjunct) Iikka Virkkunen and the staff in the Materials to Products group. Additional collaboration is planned with TWI (UK), BAM (Germany), and Nova School of Science and Technology (Portugal).Your Experience And AmbitionsThe applicant needs to have an Doctoral degree. Good skills in English, writing and oral, are needed.The ideal background for this research would include:Experience on NDE, especially ultrasonics and digital radiographyFamiliarity with modern NDE data reconstruction algorithms (FMC, PWI, TFM)Practical experience on training and testing machine learning modelsProficiency with Python, in particular in connection with data-manipulation of high-dimensional dataExperience with modern annotation tools like CVAT, NapariThe working language of the project will be English.It’s not just about machine learning. It’s not just about NDE. It’s about leveraging modern machine learning tools to create the future of NDE.What We OfferThe group at Aalto is in the vanguard of the young field of machine learning in NDE with tight industry connections multiple industry-first advances. This is an opportunity to slingshot your carreer with good support and ambitious but well grounded research project.The employment contract includes occupational health care, and Finland has a comprehensive social security system. The employment relationship is full-time, fixed-term employment at Aalto University ending September 30th 2027.Start of employment as soon as possible, from October 23th at the earliest and from December 1st 2023 at the latest.Join us!To apply for the position, please submit your application electronically through our online recruitment system and provide the following documents in English:Letter of motivationCV including publications if anyDescription of your Doctoral thesis projectCopies of degree certificates and transcript of records (both BSc and MSc)Recommendation letters (max. 3), if already available. Shortlisted candidates will be asked to provide themThe deadline for applications is October 19th , 2023, at 23:59 Finnish time (UTC +2).Aalto University reserves the right for justified reasons to leave the position open, to extend the application period, and reopen the application process.Please note: Aalto University’s employees and visitors should apply for the position via the internal HR system Workday (Internal Jobs –> Find Jobs) by using their existing Workday user account.For more informationFor additional information, please contact Professor Iikka Virkkunen, (Iikka.virkkunen@aalto.fi +358503475557). In questions related to the recruitment process, please contact HR Advisor Paula Thomsson-Levä (paula.thomsson-leva@aalto.fi .More about Aalto University:Aalto.fitwitter.com/aaltouniversityfacebook.com/aaltouniversityinstagram.com/aaltouniversityInterested?Check out our new virtual campus experience: https://virtualtour.aalto.fi/About FinlandFinland is a great place for living with or without family – it is a safe, politically stable and well-organized Nordic society. Finland is consistently ranked high in quality of life and was just listed again as the happiest country in the world: https://worldhappiness.report/news/its-a-three-peat-finland-keeps-top-spot-as-happiest-country-in-world/. For more information about living in Finland: https://www.aalto.fi/en/careers-at-aalto/living-in-finland & https://www.aalto.fi/en/services/welcome-to-aalto-university-and-finland-info-package .SUOMEKSIAalto-yliopistossa tiede ja taide kohtaavat tekniikan ja talouden. Rakennamme kestävää tulevaisuutta saavuttamalla läpimurtoja avainalueillamme ja niiden yhtymäkohdissa. Samalla innostamme tulevaisuuden muutoksentekijöitä ja luomme ratkaisuja maailman suuriin haasteisiin. Yliopistoyhteisöömme kuuluu 13 000 opiskelijaa ja yli 4500 työntekijää, joista 400 on professoreita. Kampuksemme sijaitsee Espoon Otaniemessä. Monimuotoisuus on osa meitä, ja teemme jatkuvaa työtä yhteisömme monimuotoisuuden ja syrjimättömyyden varmistamiseksi. Siksi kannustammekin päteviä hakijoita taustasta riippumatta liittymään yhteisöömme.Aalto-yliopiston Insinööritieteiden korkeakoulu hakee Tutkijatohtoria Konetekniikan laitokselle.Koneoppivia järjestelmiä on viime vuosina opittu käyttämään vaativan tarkastusdatan analysoinnissa ja vikojen havaitsemisessa. Aihe on edelleen voimakkaan tutkimuksen kohteena. Viimeaikainen tutkimus on kohdistunut lähinnä aiemmin tunnettujen menetelmien data- analyysin automatisointiin. Koneoppivat järjestelmät mahdollitavat myös uudentyyppiset tarkastusmenetelmät, joissa yhdistetään eri menetelmistä saatua dataa (data fusion) joka on liian laajaa perinteisin keinoin analysoitavaksi. Tämä mahdollistaa kokonaan uudentyyppiset data-lähtöiset tarkastukset.”Koneoppiva rikkomaton tarkastus” -tutkimushanke vastaa tähän haasteeseen kehittämällä rikkaita monia menetelmiä hyödyntäviä tietoaineistoja ja kehittämällä uusia koneoppimiseen perustuvia analyysitekniikoita. Tunnettuja malliarkkitehtuureja laajennetaa ja uusia tutkitaan yhdistävän analyysin mahdollistamiseksi.Työkielenä tehtävässä on englanti ja työ edellyttää sujuvaa suullista ja kirjallista kielitaitoa. Tarkempi kuvaus englanniksi yllä.Kiinnostuitko?Hakeaksesi rooliin, lähetä hakemuksesi ja pyydetyt liitteet rekrytointijärjestelmämme kautta ”Apply now”- linkistä mahdollisimman pian. Hakuaika päättyy 19.10.2023 klo 23.59 Suomen aikaa (UTC +2). Jos olet Aallon työntekijä tai vierailija, haethan sisäistä hakukanavaa käyttäen kirjautumalla ensin Workday-järjestelmään (internal jobs).Lisätietoja tehtävästä antaa professori Iikka Virkkunen, (Iikka.virkkunen@aalto.fi +358503475557). Rekrytointijärjestelmään liittyvissä kysymyksissä auttaa HR Advisor Paula Thomsson-Levä (paula.thomsson-leva@aalto.fi .Aalto-yliopistostaAalto-yliopistossa tiede ja taide kohtaavat tekniikan ja talouden. Rakennamme kestävää tulevaisuutta saavuttamalla läpimurtoja avainalueillamme ja niiden yhtymäkohdissa. Samalla innostamme tulevaisuuden muutoksentekijöitä ja luomme ratkaisuja maailman suuriin haasteisiin. Yliopistoyhteisöömme kuuluu 13 000 opiskelijaa ja yli 4500 työntekijää, joista 400 on professoreita. Kampuksemme sijaitsee Espoon Otaniemessä. Monimuotoisuus on osa meitä, ja teemme jatkuvaa työtä yhteisömme monimuotoisuuden ja syrjimättömyyden varmistamiseksi. Siksi kannustammekin päteviä hakijoita taustasta riippumatta liittymään yhteisöömme.Haluatko tietää lisää Aalto-yhteisöstä? Voit katsoa nämä videot: Aalto University – Towards a better world, Aalto People , and Shaping a Sustainable Future. Lue lisää Aallossa työskentelystä: https://www.aalto.fi/fi/toihin-aaltoonTutustu uuteen virtuaalikampuskokemukseemme: virtualtour.aalto.fi/Aalto-yliopisto verkossa:aalto.fitwitter.com/aaltouniversityfacebook.com/aaltouniversityinstagram.com/aaltouniversityAalto-yliopistolle on myönnetty HR Excellence in Research -laatumerkki Euroopan komissiossa, joka takaa, että noudatamme laadukkaita HR-käytäntöjä sekä rekrytoinnissa että työsuhteissa.More about Aalto University:Aalto.fitwitter.com/aaltouniversityfacebook.com/aaltouniversityinstagram.com/aaltouniversity

company: Target Vision Oy - Executive Search & Recruitment Tailor Made Solutions in Finland and International
description: We are looking for a Machine Learning SW expert to improve our deployment from Python to mobile runtime stream. This work focuses on exporting the developed ML models from Python development environment to our mobile runtime environment (C++). There are two main areas of focus, model export to mobile format and then mobile ML model execution on device. This requires compilation and integration into our software product’s runtime environment.The work includes evaluation of ARM NN SDK (C++) features regarding Onnx and TFLite support and limitations as well as performance evaluation on converted models. A study on the workload for runtime conversion of PyTorch in Android AOSP environment is needed. Also, the work effort required for maintenance (version updates) and dependency identification is part of this work. An important part of the work consists of integrating ARM NN SDK into our existing C++ implemented solution. This includes changes required to make our SW product’s SDK API and its compilation and testing with our ML models suitable. The goal is to ensure modest workload for version updates with automation of testing and compilation, especially in Android Open Source Project (AOSP) project.The most important part of the work is PyTorch -> mobile conversion and runtime environment design and implementation. The current implementation flow from TensorFlow to TFLite model in TFLite runtime is to be changed to a flow from PyTorch to mobile optimized model. This work includes selection of suitable format at Python level (e.g. Onnx, TFLite, PyTorch mobile optimized) as well as evaluation and creation of conversion path from PyTorch to target format. There are several options, each with different constraints related to e.g. quality or predictable execution speed. Also, model optimization, such as quantization, is needed as part of the conversion flow. Compilation and integration against our SW product’s SDK API and testing with our ML models is to be done to verify the conversion.The recommended locations are Tampere or Espoo. The assumption is that most of the work can be done remotely, but network access requires a laptop managed by the client. We will provide the devices required for the work.We estimate that a skilled expert could complete this work by the end of 2023, if the start would be in August.After successful completion of this project, there may be new needs for a possible follow-up project.Skills and qualifications required Strong practical experience in Maching Learning development workflow Deep understanding of Onnx, TFLite and PyTorch ML development environments Good understanding of common DNN models model architecture and their parameters in each target ML development environment Excellent C++ SW development skills Understanding of Android AOSP Build engineering skills (CMake, Soong/Bazel for AOSP) Experience with ARM NN SDK Experience in implementing and testing ML-based solutions on ARM with Android OS and HW device Very good general software development skills with experience in using GitLab/GitHub and CI/CD

Please note we are open to application from candidates from any Nordic countries!Early Career Development ProgramDo you want to be in a customer-facing role that uses both your technical and interpersonal abilities? Do you want to be an Engineer but also get to use your people skills to sell innovative new solutions?This is an exciting time for you to kickstart your career in the IT industry. Digital transformation is everywhere, with technologies such as AI/ML, Automation, IoT, multi-cloud and 5G driving the next waves of innovation. Juniper Networks is at the heart of this transformation with our industry-leading technologies that are helping to resolve the most sophisticated issues in connectivity.Sales Engineers are the technical specialists who articulate and accelerate time-to-value for customers by leveraging solutions for Cloud, AI-Ops, operational simplicity, and service-assurance enabled architectures. You will become the technical lead who works with our customers to understand their business issues, networking and security constraints, and then apply Juniper technology to solve those problems. You will be able to apply your passion for technology to excite our customers, and provide them with the best possible experience and outcomes.If you enjoy real-world application of knowledge to seek solutions to problems, Sales Engineering is an extraordinary place to be! Are you willing to unleash your potential?The Associate SE Program is a career development program designed to rapidly onboard new engineers. The program starts in September 2023 with an intensive, hands-on training and development phase where you will begin to learn fundamental Juniper technology and professional skills.You will then move into the apprenticeship phase of the program where you will focus on real-world projects to deepen your Juniper technology knowledge, hands-on skills, and customer interaction experience.Responsibilities will vary depending on each assignment, but will include such goals as the following:Attend and assist onsite customer presentations and engagements, including solution demonstrationsPrepare technical responses to customer proposals and follow up on customer questionsParticipate in the development of lab proof-of-concept configurations based on test plansDeliver training and workshopsSeek to learn and build solutions that fit customer needsMinimum Qualifications:A recent Bachelors or Masters graduate with a degree in a related field like Engineering or Computer Science Deep and incurable curiosityInterpersonal and teamwork skillsStrong communications skills, including writing and speakingYou must fluently speak Finnish and English The right-to-work in the program country is essential for this positionDesired Qualifications:General knowledge of computer networking solutionsCloud networking and OS virtualization technologies knowledge a plusExperience with Python or similar scripting languages a plusOther InformationThe working language at Juniper is EnglishFluency at least in one Nordic language Relocation is not available

This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and OpenStack. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.As a software engineer on the OpenStack Engineering team, you'll be building Charmed OpenStack and Ceph, a suite of open source Python based charms for deploying and managing OpenStack and Ceph. Your work will bring cloud platform technologies to a wide range of users and computing environments, from desktops to bare metal servers. This role requires a python software developer with a passion for automating infrastructure as code.Applicants should be passionate about the future of the software defined datacenter, distributed systems, and open source. Canonical is a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion, and you will need to work well in that context.
